title: More efficient logic needed for disk sorting when there are border values for row values
description:
Currently, when sorting data on disk with a total of 40000 rows and a program that processes data up to a maximum of 40000 rows, the following operations occur:
1. [Not provided]
OB: When sorting on disk with 40000 rows of data and a program that processes only a subset of the data, there is a logical issue.
EB: To improve the sorting process on disk when border values for row values are encountered, a more efficient approach is required. One possible solution is to directly sort the data in memory and then write it to the file.
